instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board no green light missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Someone played around with smc so i resoldered it. I also replaced <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, there was a missing backlight IC i've soldered a new one and also replacedU7100. I  finally managed to get a green light but no power. Diode mode on <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> pin 1 id 0.3 and pin 2 0.5 voltages also correct. I noted something strange on <CAPACITOR>C7094</CAPACITOR> on pin 1 (<SIGNAL>P3V42G3H_BOOST</SIGNAL>) i have 7.2V and pin 2 is ok it's 3.4v.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.2v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is 0.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 0.8v
J6100 removed

Any ideas?  

Thanks :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
First post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; be sure F7100 is good.
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
F7140 is good.  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> diode mode on F7410 pin 2 0.46 and pin 1 is 0.116 when F7410 removed.
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>:
pin 1 0.26v, pin 2 12.8v, pin 3 3.9v, pin 9 4.2v, pin 12 3.4v, pin 13 3.4v, pin 14 3.4v, pin 15 0.28, pin 17 0.8v, pin 19 5.3v, pin 20 5.3v, pin 27 14.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
"pin 9 4.2v"
Are you sure about this?
Check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces.
Also be sure <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> has correct value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: I replaced <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 they were bad now it's the correct value on all of them and on Pin 9 now i have 0.8v but i think this <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is not good :D

threads.message: Just saw that it's overheating :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: I replaced another 2 new and from another board still same. Now pin 9 is 0.7 diode value which is correct and 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: Thought i'd chip in here as i've been trolled by these before - if either <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> or <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> has or had a fault they will tend to burn the other one. So if you had a short on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> then you need to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, if you replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> without replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> you have probably killed the new <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Replace both <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> with new and try. Also check resistance to ground at L7310 - if it's low 1-2ohms you have got a dead processor and basically a trash board so don't waste any time if this is the case!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message: Post again <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages and diode mode on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
This morning i noticed i got  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6v and diode mode is 0.135 both side on F7410

pin 1 0v, pin 2 14.6v, pin 3 3.9v, pin 9 0v, pin 12 3.4v, pin 13 3.4v, pin 14 3.4v, pin 15 0.06v, pin 17 8.6v, pin 19 5v, pin 20 5v, pin 27 14.6v

I can replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> no problem but it was showing 0v on  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  maybe it needed cleaning from flux <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

threads.message: After replacement of <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> L7130 pin 1 diode value is 0.130 and 14v which is not good should be 8.6v and i replaced <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> still the same. On Pin 2 of L7130 it's 8.6v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light no power
threads.message:
Why did you change anything, if already got correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>???
Now you have burnt <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, at least.

Please clarify the actual situation; 14V, or 8.6V at L7130?

threads.message:

Thanks
